utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi, how was the screening?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, Sheldon invoked Rosa Parks to make somebody who cut the line feel bad, but only the white people felt bad.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh, I should’ve never bought him that colouring book that explains Black History Month.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How’d it go with my mother?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, you know, it started a little rocky, but I think we got to a good place.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow. Well done.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, and when I dropped her off at the hotel, she even gave me a hug.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did she think you were choking or… I’m sorry, that’s great. Thank you for spending time with her.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No problem. Um, so listen, I don’t know if you have any plans next weekend, but I kind of promised your mom we’d have another wedding ceremony so she could attend this time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wait, we’re gonna get married again?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, kind of, but now we can invite our friends and family.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Seems like a lot of trouble for a hug.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, it’ll be fun, and, you know, your mom was genuinely hurt we didn’t invite her to the first one.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, in our defence, it was kind of a spur of the moment thing, and also, we don’t like her.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard, come on, she’s your mom. If we can do something to make her happy, why wouldn’t we?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I just said why, we don’t like her.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, look, then forget about her, let’s do it for us. We could keep it small and informal. This time we can invite our families.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is your brother out of prison?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks to overcrowding, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’d love it if my dad could come.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, you have to invite him. I haven’t seen him since the divorce.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, he’s like a different man. He stopped twitching, and I think he grew an inch and a half.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, then it’s settled. Yay. So funny. I never thought my second marriage would be to you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, so it’s not a legal ceremony, it’s just a chance for us to redo our vows so everyone can be part of it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So there’s no maid of honour?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Huh. But if I were to, say, wear a purple satin dress with a sweetheart neckline and stand near you, you wouldn’t be able to stop me, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t see how I could.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Then I graciously accept.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Who’s going to officiate?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I was kind of hoping you would.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Wait, now I’m just some lousy maid of honour?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, good news, I just got off the phone with my mother. She is coming to the wedding.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, wait, you’re inviting people to our wedding?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, I’m inviting people to our wedding. Yeah, I’ve already asked Stephen Hawking and Robert Downey Jr, and, now don’t get your hopes up, ’cause he’s pretty busy, but Erno Rubik.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Who’s Erno Rubik?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Seriously? He invented the Rubik’s Cube.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, fine, but why would you invite him to our wedding?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because, despite his fame and fortune, he strikes me as a lonely man.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, it’s very sweet of you to go to all this trouble for Leonard’s mother.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m also doing it for Leonard. I think this could really help their relationship.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: How dare you invite your father without consulting me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry, but I don’t think I need your permission to have my father at my wedding.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: You do understand our marriage ended because he had an affair.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know, and there’s no excuse for that.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: He claimed I was cold, emasculating, and hadn’t shown him any physical affection for years.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was wrong, there’s three excuses for that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, my God. It’s working.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look. The system is maintaining its own stability, the quantum vortex apparatus is now controlling the orientation.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re right. You realize what this means?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. I do. It’s proof of concept. We’ve got a workable guidance system.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks. Hey, I just got an e-mail from the U.S. Air Force.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Open it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hmm. We request a meeting at your earliest convenience regarding your quantum guidance system, provisional patent 62/295118. That’s weird.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is there a window around here we don’t know about?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sure it’s just a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, of course. What else could it be? Boy, do I love America.

utterance.speaker: Mary Cooper
utterance.content: Thank you for picking me up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, you’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: I was speaking to your young lady.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: My pleasure, Mrs. Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Oh, please call me Mary.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, Mary.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, that doesn’t work for me, let’s stay with Mrs. Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Sheldon, don’t be silly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wu-wu, what? That’s what I called you till I got to know you better.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: It was so nice of Leonard and Penny to invite me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, actually, I…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It sure was.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: I’ve always had a special place in my heart for Leonard. Taking care of my baby all these years.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, I take care of him.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Sure you do. So who else is coming to this shindig?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, well, the usual gang. Penny’s family is coming tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, and Leonard’s mother’s already here.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Oh, Beverly. How nice.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’ve met her, right?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Yes, I have.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mother, she’s an atheist, not a vampire.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Either way, let’s stop and get some garlic.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: So, Mary, how have you been?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Well, thank you so much for asking. I’ve been well, and you?

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: Very good.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know what we were worried about, they’re getting along great.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Sheldon tells me your husband’s coming.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: My ex-husband.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Oh, I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: Don’t be.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Whew, chilly.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think I can see my breath.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: We can hear you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I can’t believe I was so naive. The military is just gonna take over the whole project. And you know what happens if we object? We disappear. Like off the map. Like every American Idol winner since season four.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come on, Howard, you’re overreacting.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Am I? Am I? What, what do you want to bet some black ops guy is reprinting my high school yearbook and I’m no longer in it? That chess club picture is now just David Zimmerman and Elaine Cho.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, look, I’m on the Air Force Web site, and the department that e-mailed you is in charge of acquisitions. So maybe they just want to give you a lot of money for your invention.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, please, that’s not how it works. You saw E.T., Avatar, Jurassic World. The military just shows up and takes over.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You do realize those weren’t documentaries, right?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, you find this funny?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, I was just thinking about Jurassic World. Boy, that was terrible.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, we have to use the stairs.

utterance.speaker: Alfred Hofstadter
utterance.content: When are they gonna fix your elevator?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, I don’t, any day now.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Well, the stairs are fine. Besides, your mother is up there. Maybe I’ll have a heart attack and not have to see her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, I, I know things are a little rough with you and Mom, but I’m really glad you’re here.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Me, too. I should have never had that angioplasty because I feel fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny’s really looking forward to seeing you.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Ah, she’s a sweetie. You got a good one there, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thanks, Dad.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: How the hell did you do that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Isn’t this nice?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, we’re here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Alfred. Thank you for coming!

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Oh. Well, happy to be here. And congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Dad, you remember Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Dr. Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Dr. Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This is Sheldon’s mother, Mary.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: How do you do?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And his girlfriend, Amy.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: A pleasure.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And, of course, Mom.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Hello, my hateful shrew.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: Hello to you, you wrinkled old bastard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, now I’m starting to sense a little tension.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, you two, don’t start. Penny and I are throwing this second wedding for your benefit. Can you please not ruin it?

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Of course. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: Oh, look at that, you can apologize.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mom.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: You know, the Bible says forgiveness…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mom.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, who’s hungry? We have a reservation at the best restaurant in town.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It only got three-and-a-half stars on Yelp.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not sorry. That’s true.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know what to do. It’s the Air Force. I mean, should I respond to their e-mail? Ignore it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You can’t ignore it. It’s not that postcard that says it’s time to go back to the dentist.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Guys, come on. We’re meeting everyone for dinner.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: One sec. I’m just afraid if I respond, then they’ll know I got it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, dude. The minute you opened that e-mail, they knew you got it. I mean, they’re probably looking at you through the camera right now. I love America.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you done with this nonsense?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s not nonsense. This is how the U.S. military works.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, if it’s even the U.S. Military. It could be foreign military pretending to be American.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re right. We turn our guidance system over to them, next thing we know, they’re using it against us.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I also love the enemies of America.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: Penny, I hope the example of my failed marriage to Leonard’s father doesn’t discourage you from the commitment you’ve made to one another.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, of course not.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: Although Alfred and I had a lot more going for us than you two.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mom, please save something for the toast.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: So, Alfred, what is it that you do for a living?

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Oh, I’m an anthropologist. I study ancient peoples and cultures.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: My goodness, so all the way back to the Flood.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t laugh, she wasn’t joking.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Play with your phone.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Well, on that note, there are many cultures that have an apocalyptic flood as part of their mythology.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: I don’t have a mythology. I have the unerring Word of God. But that’s very interesting.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Oh. I, I didn’t mean to disparage your faith. Actually, I admire it.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Yes. Yes, I’m an agnostic myself, but I have prayed, many times, to God, to turn my wife into a pillar of salt.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Well, He came close. Turned her into a giant block of ice.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Howard, there must be someone at the university you can go to for help.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Are you kidding? They’re probably the ones who leaked it to the military in the first place.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What about the guy on the Channel Four News? You know, Four on Your Side? Maybe he can be on your side.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m being harassed by the government, not trying to get to the bottom of a dog-walking scam.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, stop. You know what’s really happening? All the movies you’ve watched, the TV shows, the comic books, they’ve completely twisted your thinking. No one’s after you, no one’s listening to you, no one cares about you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’d like to think the Four on Your Side guy cares about me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, Beverly, I know you and Alfred have your differences, but if you think about it, if you hadn’t married him, there’d be no Leonard. So that’s good, right?

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is that Howard in front of us?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, maybe. Get closer.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, God. I think someone’s following us.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re being ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m not being ridiculous, he’s right on my tail.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, turn left here and see if he turns with us.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, why is he turning here? The restaurant’s the other way.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. He uses that traffic app. Maybe there’s an accident.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, so follow him.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I told you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s probably just a coincidence. Speed up a little, see if he stays with you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, go faster. You’re losing him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is his hurry?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what, flash your lights. Let him know it’s you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s flashing his lights. What’s that mean?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I, I think he wants us to pull over.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do not pull over. I’m not raising this baby alone.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hang on.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: So, after your husband passed, you never remarried?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: No, just focused on work and the church.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Ah. And what do you do?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: I work at the church.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Well, they’re lucky to have you.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Well, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you realize what’s happening here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I do. They’re filling up on bread and ruining their meal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What took you guys so long?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, we were following Howard, but for some reason, he turned off his headlights and went up a one-way street.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, what did we miss?

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Oh, just Mary and I getting to know each other a little.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Leonard, your father is just charming.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: He’s also broke. Did he mention that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, Mom, you sit over there.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m gonna call Bernadette and see what’s keeping them.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If I’d known you were broke, I wouldn’t have made a big deal about the bread.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (on phone)
utterance.content: Hey, Penny. What are you talking about? Oh, that was you? Long story. Why don’t you go ahead and eat. We’re gonna be a while.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m telling you, I’m not on drugs. The government’s out to get me.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Now, one of the more exciting things to be found recently is that Neanderthals and Homo Sapiens frequently mated with each other.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: Well, that certainly explains my marriage to Sheldon’s father.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s funny, because my father was not a very clever man.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’d be lost without you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, I would like to propose a toast to my wife and bride-to-be.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: See, that’s funny because…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Back to your phone.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, I’ve always known I loved you, but this last year has shown me that I also love being married to you. Thank you for saying yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, thanks for asking until I did.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hear, hear.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: I, uh, I would also like to make a toast.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Leonard, I am so happy that you have found a woman who loves and cares for you.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: What the hell is that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Why don’t you take a pill?

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: Like you did before sex?

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: What I really needed was a blindfold.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: All right, everyone, calm down. Let’s all remember what it says in the Bible: He who is slow to anger is better than the mighty.

utterance.speaker: Beverly
utterance.content: Oh, dear woman, can you please read another book?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: When God writes one, I will.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, if, if we want to order the soufflé, we might want to get on that.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Leonard, if you don’t mind, I, I think I’m a little tired. I’m gonna call it a night.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure, Dad.

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: I’m a little tuckered out myself, so I will see you all in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Would you like to share a cab?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: That would be fine.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Where are you staying?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: I’m at the Westin.

utterance.speaker: Alfred
utterance.content: Oh, so am I. Can I interest you in a nightcap?

utterance.speaker: Mary
utterance.content: I think that you could.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What is happening there?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think it’s pretty obvious. They don’t want dessert ’cause they filled up on bread.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She’s still not answering.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: My father’s not texting me back.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: ‘Cause they both turned their phones off.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t like this at all.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t like it either.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? ‘Cause I love it.
